What I'm actually doing is calculating the difficulty using a custom function and then the solution hash should have as many '0' as difficulty at the beginning. So, to mint a valid bloxel with dif 5 you'll need a hash like 00000a4f9276e...

> [redstoneb](#comment_4_15dMbdM7c2RT9RhNTJRqzc4vYSvrSJvxyG): Great way to prevent spam! Kinda like Captcha but for computers, I guess. I love your site shows what we can do with Zeronet.
> By the way, how do you handle conflicts? (Like if I edited a pixel offline but another person edited as well, and what happens when I come online?)

Every bloxel has an offset relative to the timestamp of the previous one. The difficulty function is based on this offset. The lesser the offset, the higher the difficulty. If there are two bloxels with same sequence number, the one with the lesser offset wins.
